sect1.title: &productname; hardware requirements
sect1.para: &productname; has the following minumum hardware requirements:
The recommended hard disk space is 20 GB for &slema; itself and 40 GB for containers data. Bear in mind that actual hardware requirements depend on workloads of your containers.

sect2.title: The language nad keyboard selection
sect2.para: The default language and keboard layout is English (US). If you want to choose a different language in the Language drop down menu.

Read the licence agreement. The default languange is English, but the licence agreement is available in multiple languages. To get a particular translation, click Licence translations and in the drop-down menu select the desired language and click OK. After you read the licence agrement, check I Agree to the Licence Terms and click Next to proceed to the next installaton step.

sect2.title: Registration
sect2.para: In order to receive technical support and product updates, you need to register and activate your &productname; with the &scc; or a local registration server.

listitem.para: To register with the &scc;, enter the E-mail Address associated with your SCC account and the Registration Code for &productname;. Proceed with Next.

term.guimenu: Register system via local SMT server

listitem.para: If your organization provides a local registration server, you may alternatively register there. Activate Register System via local SMT Server and either choose a URL from the drop-down box or type in an address. Proceed with Next.
If you want to skip registration, click Skip Registration. Accept the warning with OK and proceed with Next.

important.title: Skipping the registration
important.para: Your system needs to be registered in order to retrieve updates and to be eligible for support. Skipping the registration is only possible when installing from the &packagemedia; image.

sect2.para: After completing the registraton, click Next.

sect2.title: NTP servers configuration
sect2.para: In order to keep time on your system properly synchronized, configure at least one NTP server.

sect2.title: Authentication for &rootuser;
sect2.para: Configure a strong password for &rootuser;. You can import already existing ssh key by clicking Browse and selecting the ssh key.
Click Next to proceed to the next installation step.

sect2.title: Installation settings
sect2.para: The last installation step provides a summary of installation settings, review the settings and—if necesasry—perform changes. To change a setting, click the setting headline.

listitem.para: To modify partitions, you can use the Expert partiotioner. To encrypt your disk or to enable logical volume managment, click Guided Setup and then fill in a password for the disk decryption.

Clicking Software opens the Software Selection and System Tasks screen, where you can change the software selection by selecting or deselecting patterns. Each pattern contains several software packages needed for specific functions. To view and manage these packages, click Details.

By default the time is synchronized by using NTP servers you provided in previous steps of the installation procedure, but you can select the region and time zone. If you want to set the time and date manually, click the Other settings button and select Manually.
Displays the current network configuration. Click Network Configuration to change the settings.
This section shows the boot loader configuration. Changing the defaults is only recommended if really needed. Refer to for details.

Kdump saves the memory image (core dump) to the file system in case the kernel crashes. This enables you to find the cause of the crash by debugging the dump file. Kdump is preconfigured and enabled by default. See for more information.
Only the text mode is available.
View detailed hardware information by clicking System. In the resulting screen you can also change Kernel Settings—see for more information.

sect2.para: If you reviewed the installation settings, you can proceed to the installation by clicking Install and then confirming the installation.

sect1.title: Unattended installation by using &ay;
sect1.para: &productname; can be install by using &ay; by using a control file also called profile. &ay; then installs &slema; as described in but omits the second stage.
The control file must nbe created manually and you can use the following template to do so.
